message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of data exchange between two parties, which is a fundamental problem in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also derives a lower bound on the minimum number of bits needed for data exchange, which involves relating the problem to secret key agreement (cs.CR). The paper proposes a new interactive protocol for data exchange, which involves increasing the communication size in steps until the task is done, and this involves designing efficient algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the optimal rate of communication needed for data exchange for a general sequence, which involves analyzing the performance of algorithms (cs.CC). Finally, the paper characterizes the asymptotic reduction in the length of optimal communication due to interaction, which involves analyzing the behavior of algorithms as the input size grows (cs.LG).
